reviewText:
I have played the Escapists but did not like it very much. Don't get me wrong, I understand why people like the game but it just was not for me. With the Escapists I missed depth and story which this version of the game has.

The Escapists: The Walking Dead is a fun game if you enjoy the Walking Dead. In this game you take control of Rick Grimes and you have to make sure you save everyone from the zombies. Instead of having to make sure your heat level is low for the guards which was never a big issue, NOW IT IS!!! If the zombie meter gets too high zombies will walk inside your perimiter causes a lot of damage/trouble. So this game causes you to think more about what is best for you and the other survivors then just trying to escape.

I think this version of the game has more depth story wise and the way you play the game. You have to make sure morale is high otherwise characters might go crazy :)

Just in short: If you like the escapists but want a bit more variety in game play and a more in depth experience, then you should play this game :)

reviewText:
It looks like a cool little game, and I bought it to play on my laptop, as my PC is currently unavailable. Music is cool, and the 8-bit atmosphere is very well crafted.

The tutorial could do with a bit more work; originally I picked up the first zombie and carried her around until I worked out how to drop her. The controls are a bit too simple: the same button which means attack" also means "carry" and "drop".

Once past the first bit of the first level
recommended: I could not progress. I need to fire a gun in order to proceed
hoursPlayed: but the gun cannot be fired. The tutorial is clear on what I need to do (press right-button or SPACE to aim and left button to fire). Pressing space works just fine
voteText: and the zombie gets targetted. However
helpfulPercent: pressing the left button then does nothing. Not a thing. I spent about ten minutes trying different combinations
votesHelpful: verifying the controls section of the pause menu
votesTotal: and trying to use both buttons at the same time rather than SPACE. Both buttons at the same time may not work on the mousepad for this laptop
votesFunny: but SPACE and left-button should work. It doesn't.\n\nI hope this gets fixed soon
commentsCount: because this does look like  fun little game
column16: and I am a huge fan of the TV show.\n\n**EDIT** The guys at Team17 saw this reviw and contacted me via comments very quickly. An email exchange followed. That's great support
column19: but I could continue play using a USB mouse. My tests found that it appears to be an issue with Windows 10 and/or DirectX. Other games turn out to be affected in an identical way.\n\nI progressed to level 2
column20: and this does look like a fun little game. I will be playing it more when I get access to a USB mouse on a regular basis."

reviewText:
Let me start off with saying, that I love 'The Escapists'. Personally, I think this game could do with some many improvements and bug fixes. To make things clear, I'll use the Pros and Cons List.

PROS
-Unique Concept

CONS
-Buggy Tutorial
-Strange Controls
-Graphics (I'll talk about this later)
-Tutorial Lacking Vital Information
-Wonky Combat System

That's it for the pros and cons, now to explain why I chose the cons.

Buggy Tutorial: Your clicking on stuff the game tells you to click on is pretty much random if you actually perform the action. As an example, I kept clicking with the shovel in the underground section to dig straight up, on the 100th or so click, it finally worked.

Strange Controls: In the original 'The Escapists', you had to open a menu to equip clothes and weapons, and I liked that. In this game, you have to select the weapon in your hotbar, and press 'E' to equip it. Another strange control change, to stand on desks in the original game, you just had to walk into it. Here, you must press 'F' to stand on the desks. You also use 'F' to give NPCs items. What happened to the give mechanic?

Graphics: I'm so going to get screamed at for this... The graphics look like someone took them straight from the Xbox One version of the original game. Oh wait... What I'm trying to say here, is that I want the graphics to look more like 'The Escapists' on PC. Save these ones for the Xbox One release.

Tutorial Lacking Vital Information: The tutorial lacks information on the Threat Meter, the Health Meter, and the Energy Meter. These are important. I kept wondering why people won't follow me when I clicked on them. (Because that's how you make them follow you. What happened to the 'Q' key? Oh wait, they used that to dismiss people. Wow.)

Wonky combat System: In this game, the combat system is like if Team Fortress 2 was 2D. There's no Lock-On like in the original game, and there's barely any feedback that you actually hit an enemy. (Besides a quiet noise, and a tiny health bar below.)


That's it for my review, I'll list the score below, but before that, I want to say that If Team17 updates this game in any way that will make me change my review, then I will.

MY SCORE FOR THE ESCAPISTS: THE WALKING DEAD IS... 39%

reviewText:
From someone who-
- Has never played the original Escapists
- Is a complete Walking Dead wh*ore
- Doesn't care that much for these top-down style games

I've really enjoyed this game so far. I had this game at the top of my wish list for quite some time and managed to pick it up during the Steam Exploration Sale for $8.99. My only main issue surrounding this game is the fact that this is not worth the original $19.99 price. Even $8.99 for this game is still fairly stiff.

I say this because I feel the price for the content provided is worth maybe $4.99. There are 6 (?) levels that span all across The Walking Dead universe (comics/TV show) and that's about it. There is no co-op, no online play, nothing. Just a linear single-player version of this. In my opinion, this just feels like a mod for the original Escapists game, which, to be fair it actually is a standalone mod.

As far as gameplay goes, I really enjoy it as of right now, but I've heard from reviews that this game can get a little repetitive and has a lot of unnecessary actions. I can agree on the unnecessary actions" part
date: because I think that not mending daily chores or going to meals shouldn't and doesn't result in more walker activity. That's just insane and not logical.\n\nIf you're a big Walking Dead fan who has read the comics or at least watches the show
recommended: you will DEFINITELY find this game fun and easy to understand. Otherwise
hoursPlayed: this game really punishes people who haven't read the comics.\n\nAs a conclusion
voteText: DEFINITELY get this game when it's on sale. I really think you'll be disapointed if you buy this for the retail $19.99 price tag. 7/10"

reviewText:
Greetings fellow gamers! This is Gamer Guy ( In a Suit ) from the Echo Army YouTube channel!

(NOTE: This game was reviewed using a key provided by the Developer)

Video Review:

The Escapists: The Walking Dead Review


The Too Long
recommended:
but shallow game. Lack of depth/challenge and any sort of immersion take away from the overall experience. The original Escapists is much more fun and there are far better zombie survival games available. Wait for a 66-75% off Steam Sale. 2.5/5.

The "Meat & Potatoes" Review:

The Escapists : The Walking Dead was released on September 30th by Team 17 Digital. Obviously this is the same team that brought us the original Escapists game. A fantastic little game in which you live out day to day prison life while plotting and executing an escape. This game is exactly what it sounds like. They've taken the walking dead franchise and dropped it into the Escapists environment. Replacing prison life with life as a survivor living in a survivor camp. A lot of the same gameplay elements from the original are present.

You play the game as Rick Grimes. As i just mentioned
hoursPlayed: a lot of the gameplay elements will be familiar to those gamers who have played The Escapists. You've got a schedule to keep. Theres roll call
voteText: you have your meal times
helpfulPercent: some daily chores and of course you have free time which you can use to find and craft items and weapons. There are also tasks which you must complete in order to move to the next map.\n\nMuch like the gameplay
votesHelpful: the graphics and sounds are very similar to the original Escapists. In fact
votesTotal: the graphics even appear to be slightly improved. The control scheme also is improved upon from the original with a few slight changes. It is easy to say that
commentsCount: the actual basics of the game itself have improved.\n\nUnfortunately
column16: the game just misses the mark. I enjoy the original Escapists much more than i have enjoyed this version. It simply falls short for me as a zombie survival game. The levels seem shorter and easier than they should be and there dont seem to be very many of them at all. It simply seems much....shallower than one would expect. This gamer simply cant justify a rating any higher than a 2.5 out of 5. This gamer advises waiting for that magical 66-75% off on a Steam sale before biting.\n\nHappy Gaming!!!"

reviewText:
I'm new to steam, this is the first game I bought and i completely regret it. If I wasn't as new to steam and was more aware of steams refund policy, (no more that 2 hours play refunds are invalid) I would have refunded it immediately as it took me 4 hours to get it to work.
N.B Never leave the game running in the background, even if not actually any further than the play screen. It took me over the 2 hour return limit just to get the game to start running, and I was only on the Load page with no clickable features!
As I was past the point of being able to refund by the time I Instead I persited with the glitches that would normally accompany a free to play game or a beta version.  This is a great regret of mine as I only persisted because I had paid for it. Apparently I have played the game for 51.7 hours. I have actively played it for no more than 10, but Load screens, and back ground pauses count.... OF COURSE!

I'm not going to comment like many have on the misleading nature of The Escapists brand compared to this, I don't have a measure for comparison. Personally I thought it was fine as a stand alone game if you like the style of game that require exploration rather than, games which challenge you to complete ASAP. Also this game is truer to the comics than the tv show. Which makes it interesting for me, though TV-only might dislike some missing charectors.

But the glinches and errors are constant. The lack of ability to save except when the evening hits means you can loose large amount of progress when a glitch happens. I have felt like i have repeated 50% of what I played due to having to restart. I know I have reapeated large segments.

Glitches include:
- Not loading. - It wouldn't load for a while.
- Not closing - the amount of 'force closures' I have created is rediculas.
- Charectors who follow, targeting mechanism appearing for no reason.
- Charectors who will not stop following you for an extended period dispite dismissals.
- Game failing to register daily tasks as complete, most notably evening head count.
- Invintory box vanishing completley. (This stops you from preforming daily tasks)
- left click fails to work, this prevents game saving at end of the day and all interaction with charectors.
- Desks seem to 'lose' items when they are stored in them. I have 4 boxes of ammo dissapear on me.

I cannot believe this game passed the beta test and was considered fit for sale with this number of errors.
I am utterly fuming.

It is not worth the money.

It needs overhauling.

--------------------------------------

Dear Steam,
Your refund policy is fundementally flawed if non-actve game play i.e load screens, count towards the total and prevent a refund. It is penalising people who have patience and try to resolve issues. All I have learnt to do is have a tantrum and demand a refund immediately when I have any small issue.

P.S Thanks for giving me an interesting area of law to consider, I feel this has the makings of a Disertation for a Master of Laws.

reviewText:
The game itself is very good, I have never played The Escapists but you don't need to play it to play this game.
Downs...
- GAMEPLAY: The game's timeline after the hospital goes waaaay off line! At least make some of those comic scenes on how the group gets to the greene family, the game jumps too many important parts!
-DEVELOPERS: I do feel it is necessary to add more stages to the game, it is extremely short!

reviewText: This game takes scenes from the uber popular Walking Dead series and incorporates it into video game form, using The Escapsist block style artistry.  You get to control Rick Grimes through some of the scenes of the first couple of seasons of The Walking Dead television series.  To complete the missions, Rick has to improvise and craft some makeshift tools and weapons he finds in the environment to conquer the hoards of zombies that swarm.  If you are a fan of the television show, then you will like this game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I really like this game,It has real characters from The Walking Dead from the TV series/comic series, still has the whole escapists feel, like the jobs, weapons, etc, and has some more interesting things like the Morning Headcount/Evening Headcount events, and the Vendors.The two things I don't really like in this game, is when you enter the vents then acsess the roof, ALL the NPC's glitch where they dont move until the next day, and about the amount of levels in it, but im so close to finishing the game, so I might learn why this game was shorter, Because i've never read the comics or seen the TV series, mabey theres a twist... I recommend this game to pepole who've played the escapists, because you should play that before this. Thats all I have to say.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I'm a little bit on the fence with this one mainly because I love the new shooting mechanics and I like the fact that The Escapist" franchise is branching out to adventure games
date: but I feel like they should have made their own game first instead of making ANOTHER game based on The Walking Dead. The title "The Escapist: The Walking Dead" makes this game come across as a shameless collaberative branding of two franchises that don't mix
recommended: and the tuotrial level hammers that in. Furthermore
hoursPlayed: I also thought that the "survival mode" was a good idea
voteText: but if you have a game that uses it as a selling point
helpfulPercent: you need to include a multiplayer co-op mode which (to my knowlage) this game does not have."

reviewText: This is a clever game that follows The Walking Dead story with a few deviations while still keeping the original spirit of the show alive. While it is a different genre to the original Escapists, it uses the assets and engine quite well and it bumps things up to the next level with regards to weapons and enemies. The survival mode is fun and overall it's a great way to experience the WD story.
